name: Kepler-388
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-388 Exoplanetary System

Kepler-388 is a star with 0.4899999999999999 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.59 times its radius. It is located 1993.86 light years away from the solar system.

Kepler-388 is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.

Kepler-388 b

Kepler-388 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.04 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 3.17 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-388.

The mass of Kepler-388 b is 0.58 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-388 b is 0.81 that of Earth. At less than 1.5 Earth masses, Kepler-388 b is a regular terrestrial planet, much like the terrestrial planets we find in our solar system, namely Mercury, Venus, Earth and Mars.

Kepler-388 c

Kepler-388 c was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.09 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 13.30 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-388.

The mass of Kepler-388 c is 0.68 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-388 c is 0.86 that of Earth. At less than 1.5 Earth masses, Kepler-388 c is a regular terrestrial planet, much like the terrestrial planets we find in our solar system, namely Mercury, Venus, Earth and Mars.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-388, which contains 2 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
